result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Indigency hearing on October 20, 2022 at 09:30 am.

9:32 AM 
Clerk Micki.
INCLUDES 20CM1335, 21CM1014, 22CF735, and 22CM298

Defendant appears in custody from the MCJ. 

Court questions defendant regarding Atty Bauer and representation through SPD.  
Court denies appointment of Counsel.

IH - 10/20/22 at 9:00 a.m.

Adj: 9:37 a.m.

Clerk: Amy.
Case Called:  8:31 a.m. 
INCLUDES 20CM1335, 21CM1014, 22CF734, 22CM298.
State appears by ADA Kyle Mayo; Defendant appears in in person/in custody from MCJ with Attorney Joseph Bauer by video. 

Date and time set for bond forfeiture hearing.
Atty Bauer advises he does not represent deft in 22CF734; Atty Bauer makes statement re: missed appearance, deft is currently seeking treatment. 
State makes statement.  

COURT ORDERS bond continued. 

COURT continues IH this morning and PH set in 22CF734. 

Adj:  8:34 a.m.

INCLUDES:  20CM1335, 21CM1014, 22CM298, 22CF734:  No contact with victim(s) L.K., AmericInn or J.P.P (owner); or co-Defendants Jason Collier, Melissa Buchanan, Kelly Garduno and Sean Rector. Contact includes direct personal or physical and indirect contact by phone, in writing of any kind, entry to the person's residence or place of employment together with contacts through other persons. Contact, however, may be made through the defendant's attorney. Absolute sobriety from and no possession of controlled substances except prescriptions taken as prescribed. Shall have his/her fingerprints and photograph taken at the Sheriff's Dept. Report to ATTIC Corrections Services (715-848-3202) within one business day of release. Comply with pretrial monitoring through ATTIC Correctional Services at Level (4) supervision with possible drug testing as determined by agency screening.

2:21 p.m.
Clerk: Micki. 
INCLUDES 20CM1335, 21CM1014, 22CF734, and 22CM298

State appears by ADA Rory McGarry for  ADA Kyle Mayo.  Defendant appears in custody from the MCJ via Zoom video, Attorney Joseph Bauer appears via Zoom video on the misds.  Atty Krista Cannon appears on the felony file.  

Date and time set for Hearing; VRCW. 
**COURT QUASHES WARRANT**

COURT questions Atty Bauer re: missed appearance. Atty Bauer makes statement. 
ADA McGarry requests a $250.00 cash bond to cover all files, with all other non-monetary conditions as previously ordered. 

COURT ORDERS: $250.00 cash bond to cover all files, with all other non-monetary conditions as previously ordered.
